186043873.review:
Сидя на скучной паре, года 3 назад, я буквально изнывал от тоски. Вдруг краем глаза я заметил, как мой дружок-пирожок играет во что-то с умным видом на ноутбуке. Это был Slay the spire.
На тот момент я никогда раньше не пробовал рогалики, да и пробовать было негде, играю на MacBookPro. Но эта игра оказалась мне доступна, я решил приобщиться. Сначала была пиратка, с ней скучных пар у меня больше не было. А потом пришел день и я купил эту игру, потому что она стоит того, чтобы её купить.

В этой игре нет и не было неиграбельных персонажей. В этой игре бывают очень неприятные моменты с рандомом, который любит дать тебе посмотреть на ВСЕ карты в игре, кроме той, которая тебе нужна для билда. Достижения в этой игре - отдельно доставляют, поставьте себе цель выбить 100% и у вас появится мотивация потрогать всех персонажей, попробовать собрать все возможные и невозможные билды, зачизить всех боссов, не вспотев.
Если вы любите сыр, а уж тем более, если вы готовы испробовать его в разных формах, то вам НУЖНА эта игра. 
Есть ли у неё недостатки? Конечно, недостатки есть даже у твоей мамы, но все мы её любим, несмотря на это. А любим мы её за вот этот вкус победы на губах после потных 30, 40 или даже 50 минут дрочки на подступах к "кульминации". 
Не играл - играй!
Играл - знай, я сделал все самые потные достижения на созерцающей, я трижды проклял разраба, 5 раз представил его маму, 2 раза представил его маму, представляя, что представлял её на глазах у автора, но я увековеченный, а ты?

186040242.review:
Thumb down because of the card dealing algorithm.  Too often you can build a really powerful deck and spend most of your block cards on a turn when a boss is going to deal a status efect to you and next turn the boss one shots you because, guess what: you don't have enough block cards in draw to counter it. I wonder, do they really tested it on anyone expect slot machine addicts in Las Vegas? It's obvious that the algorithm pushes gameplay too much to the gabling side, So it's more a slot machine with a little bit of strategic deck building game, that a strategic deck builder with a little bif of a slot machine.
The latter is a roguelike, the former is a joke of a game.

185938500.review:
新手四职业浅评：战士只会四件套（黑拥+硬撑+重振+全身），猎人只会四件套（余像+杂技+战术+本能），观者只会四件套（猛虎+以手+愤怒+不惧），故障机器人属于什么都可以试试但是赢得莫名其妙，输的也莫名其妙（好吧其实集中是机器人的爹，冰霜球是机器人的妈）。
探索的过程还挺有趣的，有很多套路我是不看攻略自己摸索出来的。整个爬塔过程由于有SL机制的存在也有一定的容错，实在不行重开也行，反正是卡牌肉鸽。一句话说的话，如果你喜欢小丑牌，喜欢邪恶铭刻，入手杀戮尖塔绝不会有错。如果你没玩过这类型的游戏，也可以试试。作为卡牌肉鸽的一哥游戏，这游戏各方面（除了剧情）可以说近乎完美。

185932985.review:
这是我玩过最好的肉鸽游戏之一。
当你刚开始游玩时，你会沉迷于有趣的卡牌，奇怪的怪物。一开始你的目标只有杀死第三层的boss。
当你第一次通过第三层时，你将解锁进阶模式，此时你可以进入第四层，面对强大的心脏你一次次失败，最终在某一个爽局中秒杀了心脏，你觉得这游戏不过如此。
但当你的进阶数不断上升，你发现了原来你觉得没有用或者不是太强的卡竟然在一些搭配下发挥了神奇的功效。
你不再追求roll到爽局然后大杀特杀，你开始对每个卡牌有自己独到的见解，你会根据你的卡组来选择卡牌。
当年的游玩时间越来越长，你越会发现这个游戏的卡牌设计多么精妙，如此精妙的数值设定和不断的sl已寻找通向胜利的方法都令你沉迷。
相信我，这绝对是一个能够让你直呼开发者真是个天才的游戏。

这款游戏是卡牌与Rogue结合的代表之作，游戏在卡牌游戏的基础上通过选卡，删卡，药水，遗物、加费等机制巧妙地将卡牌构筑与战斗杀敌联系在了一起，十分具有Rogue的味道。
而更值得称赞的一点是游戏体量不大，仅有四个可选角色，但每个角色都能构造出多个不同的流派，仅仅静默猎手一人就有毒流，小刀流，药水流，华丽流等多个不同的体系，可玩性极高。游戏更是能在流派构建地过程中体验到双重的爽感：第一是自己慢慢进步、逐步构建出流派的爽感，第二是战斗尤其是输出时的爽感。我个人印象最深刻的就是小刀流贼的用不停的小刀灌死敌人的爽感。
最后也是最重要的一点，游戏支持创意工坊并且拥有大量可玩性极高的MOD!我个人最喜欢的就是三国杀mod，哪位将军助我讨尖塔逆贼！
总之，我认为对于卡牌游戏和rogue的爱好者，STS都是完全的不可错过的神作。

Маленька реграбельність колоди і рандом дуже швидко притуплює позитивні відчуття. На кожного персонажа є десь по 2 варіації колоди, якщо рандом дозволить, то забіг буде адекватним. Якщо за перші бої з нормальних карт нічого не падає, то можна починати нову гру, бо більшість карт - сміття.

185779663.review:
我的力量无人能及！

我的力量有人能及啊…


---致我人生第一次玩的卡牌肉鸽神作《杀戮尖塔》
前几日冬促，购买了《杀戮尖塔》这款游戏，在玩之前心里曾想：我玩过那么多个3A大作，怎能会被一个小小的卡牌游戏震撼呢？看着steam好评如潮的评价，心里抱着不理解和尝试的态度，还是打开了游戏。

没错，我摊牌了，我彻底被这个游戏折服，从买完游戏到现在我无时不刻都在玩，目前也差不多一百小时了，如此优秀的游戏玩法和质量已经能超越很多3A大作。

再玩之前，我也确实久仰杀戮尖塔在卡牌肉鸽当中的地位，但是我也确实从来没玩过卡牌肉鸽，《杀戮尖塔》也属于我在肉鸽类游戏中的白月光了吧。确实只有在实际上手之后才能感受到其中的魅力。从最开始的重开在商店里找好遗物，到现在稍微有些对删牌过卡的理解，这种不完全依赖随机而是能够在游戏局内运营、构筑卡牌的机制正是它的魅力所在。同时四个角色特色迥异，相同角色又因为不同的牌组构筑有着不同的打法，再加上几乎毫无门槛的操作，在roguelike游戏的重开-学习的过程中，低挫败感、高成就感、对卡牌的熟悉以及逐渐对角色的理解使得游戏过程不像通常的卡牌roguelike，而更加有趣，能取舍是否该拿牌、是否该移除卡牌、接下来又该怎么构筑，这使该游戏的可重复游玩性大大增加。


前些天终于用战士，猎人和鸡煲把心脏打通关了，也算是对这游戏有些浅薄的理解了

开始玩这游戏的时候，好哥们建议我先玩鸡煲，说是鸡煲转起来特别强，而我也感受到了。

后来哥们和我说，玩战士得学会烧牌，我很诧异，明明每张牌都是我精挑细选的，为什么要把他们烧掉呢？后面理解了，把效率低的卡烧掉后，留下单卡效率最高的卡，打怪效率更高。之后喜欢上了烧牌的感觉，尤其很喜欢腐化，当把其他牌烧干净后，只剩下那几张攻击牌，颇有种破釜沉舟的感觉，就算打不过再sl嘛，把不该烧的牌留下来。

当我研究战士烧牌的时候，我认为战士是一个最需要想象力的职业，玩的时候得靠想象力。

关于杀戮尖塔的赞美太多太多了，我不想去赞美游戏的本身。我印象最深刻的一局是战士第一次打败心脏，因为卡组不太好，强度不高。我腐化黑拥SL一个小时二十次，结局依旧是输。我相信我能赢，我把29张牌牌序列出来，腐化黑拥烧完不同的牌牌序列出来，一个小时后我终于找到了那个解，最后我赢了之后长舒一口气。在那一刻我赢了游戏，在那一刻也赢了时间。或许一个小时我重开一局选牌好早赢了，可是能赢的局我不愿认输。


即使最后我们都会输给时间，这没关系，那也要谱写出每个人自己生命的赞歌。什么是生命的赞歌？或许是藏在人们骨子里的永不屈服、永不妥协、永不认输。

我的人生没办法sl，为了战胜这一路上的小怪，烧过那么多休息牌，娱乐牌，还换了那么多血，这是否真的值得？可惜这个问题的答案没法通过sl去知道了。
现在的我，就想赶快走到下一个篝火休息。人生啊，总是奔向下一个篝火，区别是以前的我会在篝火敲牌，以后我只会休息了。

最后感谢《杀戮尖塔》给我带来一百小时的快乐时光，我现在唯一后悔的就是在大学期末考试期间购买了这款游戏，这游戏真的有瘾啊！😭

lemme be clear, STS is great and for literally anyone. heres a quick breakdown of characters: Iron clad is gigachad, silent is your edge master weeb, Defect is big brain moves, and watcher is that one friend who never really got parented and so their a cry baby if anyone ever says their wrong. like i said, its for just about anyone. 

and if you're not vibing with the 4 main characters to choose from...have no fear. The amount of mods to choose from are genuinely unreal. 100's of new cards, characters, potions, events, ect...the list goes on. You want to play silent and have you character do a back flip every time you play the card [back flip], there's a mod for it. Want to skip the 2nd act and go into a jungle safari? there's a mod for it. You get stuck on loop after loop of tiktoks with the music Deja vu in the background and all of a sudden you want your character to be a car that literally drifts on enemies? there's a mod for that. Want to play another game within this game in a card format? yup, there's a mod for that. 

Between the base content (which in its own right is fantastic) and the amount of modded content people have made for STS you have the chance to spend countless hours in a game that is genuinely a blast to play and is under $30. 

P.S. Defect is king and if your maining him just know I salute you. Watcher mains are still crying in the corner.

185736946.review:
I wish there was mixed option for reviews because on one hand this game has a lot of things going for it, 4 unique characters, all with many interesting play styles, hundreds of cards, solid line-up of enemies, lots of mechanics, very addicting gameplay loop, etc., essentially everything you would want in roguelite. 

But there is just too much RNG for my taste: didn't get any block cards during your turn? gg. Got enemy that counters your build? gg. Bad cards got shuffled into your hand couple times in a row? gg. Got bad random encounter? gg. Didn't get card that's integral for your build? gg. Bad map layout? gg. It's just not fun, you don't win in this game because you played well or made good choices, you win because you got lucky. And I don't like that, in most other roguelites you can still complete a run even if your luck is bad, you just aim better, move better, play safer, you can't do that in this game because, well, it's a card game. 

Overall a fun game, but it punishes you too much for things that are out of your control.

185696421.review:
It's a moot point to bring up RNG in a roguelike deck building game but one that i think anyone who arent familiar with this genre should know. Like many roguelike out there the main goal is to mitigate and workaround the random nature of this genre, however Spire doesnt exactly make it easy..

Having beaten the final boss with all the characters i'd say the game is around 65% skill and 35% luck, the best players seems to agree on 80-90% skill and 10% luck, the ratio obviously differs depending the players ofc, players trying out the game for the first time would probably feel like it's 90% luck and 10% skill, regardless i find 35% luck is simply too much, sure if i play my card perfectly and plan out each encounter with the utmost caution i can probably bring it down to 15-20% luck but i dont find the game to be rewarding enough to justify that much effort.

However the review score should make it obvious that this game is definitely worth trying if you are remotely interested in the genre. I enjoyed the game but unfortunately Spire just isnt my type.

185682573.review:
I love this game enough to have purchased it for my phone, my tablet, and my PlayStation. 

The art is great. The card mechanics are great. The characters are great. 
There is a lot of greatness, here. 

The reason for the negative review is because the game is unbalanced. At the end of the day, yes, it is possible to make it through to A20, kill the heart, etc. It's just not consistent enough to be enjoyable. 

You will have SO many runs feeling you have been careful, planned your route, taken enough block, balanced your attack, grabbed the right relics, and you will STILL get smacked for 63 dmg. 
People try to say the game is not based on RNG and that you have a lot of control over the game.
You do not. Understanding that not every card is going to be S tier, but certain combinations are required to make it past certain bosses and you're rarely going to get to construct those decks. What is the point of having certain card mechanics if they're never going to be viable. 

Looking around online it seems that there is 1 particular run that is unwinable. Why?

It's a fun game and sometimes it feels great. It's just too disheartening.

185636535.review:
My first 500 hours in Slay the Spire were hours I didn't pay for. 

I was a kid in highschool, broke, there was only 3 characters in the game, Vine was alive and Tiktok had yet to really get a foothold in the world. It was a better time.

And I... sailed the seas. Its not something I'm ashamed of, and if you are down on your luck, still a kid, or just don't feel like jockeying the Steam refund policy to see if you like a game, most game devs would prefer thats how you play their game over buying a copy of dubious origin from a reseller. 

Why even bring this up, you might ask? Well, it was only last year that I realized how much had gone into the game, and that there was a 4th character that I had no clue even existed. And, against my better judgement with regards to my ever disappearing free time, I picked up STS again to try that 4th character. And then I started playing the other characters too. And then I started ascension runs. 

Never in all my days have I encountered such a well crafted deckbuilder. Being singleplayer, STS doesn't care if you find a combo that breaks the game and makes the enemy unable to interact with you. Slay the Spire doesn't try and limit your ceiling, it dares you to go infinite, it [i] wants [/i] you to go infinite. My favorite part of the game is how it encourages offense while putting more than enough wrinkles in your path that you can't just go full zerg rush. Fully indexing into any one thing without accounting for the counters puts you on the path to losing. 

Learning the Watcher, the illusive 4th character I didn't know existed as it got added after I put my 500 [strike] pirated [/strike] pre-purchase hours in has been one of the most enjoyable deckbuilding experiences I've had since... well since I played STS the first time. 

The main thing I was trying to do on the Watcher that was so fun was going infinite. There was a really interesting play pattern you can take where you reset a lot and chop your deck down to like 3 powers and then your 2 card combo that goes until you win. The fun part is that by taking your deck down to so few cards, any enemy that adds cards to your deck in any way is immediately the most threatening thing you could encounter. You also have to make illogical decisions in order to get to infinite. You skip like 90% of cards you are offered, you make sacrifices for some things that would never make sense in a normal run. And that is just ONE way to play the game on one character, completely ignoring everything that comes with ascension runs. 

And all of that is also completely ignoring everything that isn't purely gameplay. The art is amazing, the soundtrack is amazing, the sound DESIGN is amazing, and there has never been a better time to get into Slay the Spire because there is a sequel that looks like its amping up everything about the first game and giving more of what is undeniably one of the grandpappys of indie roguelikes. That would've been a silly statement 10 years ago, but there are so many indie roguelikes now that it can be hard to stand out among them. 

Slay the Spire has stood the test of time and remains at the top of the tower. Play this game, and if you can, uh, pay for it while you're at it... I did. Eventually.

[code] https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42143664/ [/code]

185515346.review:
Rezension zu Slay the Spire

Slay the Spire ist zweifellos ein faszinierendes Spiel mit hohem Suchtpotenzial. Die Mischung aus Deck-Building, strategischer Planung und roguelike Elementen bietet eine einzigartige Spielerfahrung, die mich stundenlang gefesselt hat. Das Gameplay ist spannend und belohnt kreatives Denken, besonders wenn man gelungene Synergien zwischen Karten entdeckt.

Allerdings gibt es auch einen Punkt, der meinen Spielspaß stark getrübt hat: der hohe Einfluss des Zufalls. Obwohl ich die Herausforderung eines anspruchsvollen Spiels durchaus schätze, fühlt es sich oft so an, als ob der Erfolg eines Runs weniger von meiner Strategie als von den zufällig angebotenen Karten abhängt. Nach über 70 Stunden Spielzeit, in denen ich trotz zahlreicher Versuche keinen einzigen Run erfolgreich abschließen konnte, hat sich Frustration breitgemacht.

Das Problem ist nicht der Schwierigkeitsgrad an sich – dieser ist sogar motivierend –, sondern dass der Zufall manchmal übermächtig wirkt. Dies hat letztendlich dazu geführt, dass ich das Spiel aufgegeben habe, obwohl es mir in vielerlei Hinsicht wirklich gut gefallen hat.

Insgesamt bleibt Slay the Spire ein großartiges Spiel, aber die starke Abhängigkeit vom Glück kann langfristig den Spaß mindern – vor allem für Spieler, die sich ein faires Erfolgserlebnis wünschen. Wirklich schade, denn das Potenzial ist riesig!

185500594.review:
[h1]絶妙なバランスが癖になる神ゲー[/h1]
ローグライクデッキ構築カードゲーム。この手のデッキ構築ゲーでは特に有名な傑作です。
最初は「これクリアできるのか…？」と思っていましたが、プレイしていく内に各キャラ毎の勝ち筋が見えてきて安定してクリアできるようになりました。
[b]プレイ毎にゲームはリセットされるがプレイヤーの経験は蓄積され続けると言うローグライクの面白い所を実感させてくれます。[/b]
1プレイ2～3時間でテンポよくプレイできるのもいいですね。
プレイングが戦闘結果に大きく反映され、雑なプレイだと大ダメージを負った戦闘でも丁寧なプレイだと無傷で撃破なんて事もよくあります。
先の展開を予測し、デッキがブン回ってワンターンキル出来たりした時は凄く気持ちいいです。
[h1]高いリプレイ性[/h1]
クリアまで2～3時間と書きましたがボリューム不足と言う事はなく、4キャラ居て各キャラ毎に違った戦い方が楽しめます。
更にマップや入手するカードは毎回ランダムなので、プレイごとに違った展開が楽しめ飽きません。
序盤で思わぬ強カードを拾えて無双できる事もあるし、デッキの軸となるカードが中々拾えずもどかしい思いをする場合もあります。

ローグライクデッキ構築ゲーに興味のある方はまずこのゲームからプレイするといいと思います。
2も発売予定なので今の内にプレイしておきましょう！

185469144.review:
Китик смерти из канализации. Нет, серьёзно, давайте не будем игнорировать слона в комнате. Точнее, кита. Няо - это китик смерти и Няо просит нас убить сердце шпиля, потому что сердце, ну, плохое. Сердце когда-то захотело победить саму смерть, и низвергло нашего китика с небес в канализацию. Теперь нам предстоит напомнить всем вообще о важности смерти (убив их).

Сюжет этого рогалика-декбилдера отдаёт первостатейной шизухой. Той, в которую сразу почему-то нежнейше влюбляешься. А по-детски наивный, но стильный (чаще его, правда, называют “уродливым”, но я не согласна) арт игры отлично работает на атмосферу.

Иии… и если честно без понятия, какой процент аудитории ничего не понял ни про рогалики, ни по декбилдеры, так что кратко поясню. Игра карточная, каждый ход мы принимаем тактическое решение - какие карты для атаки, защиты, баффа или дебаффа сыграть против конкретного противника. После боя мы пополняем нашу колоду новыми карточками. В процессе одного, длящегося от двадцати минут до двух часов, забега, мы последовательно проходим три этажа, состоящих из комнат с боями, случайных событий, и, конечно, боссов каждого биома в конце. Сохраняться можно в любой момент, большая радость в нынешние времена.

Но вот в плане сложности - да, вначале очень сложно, жалости к игроку в игре нет. Пройти можно как с первого раза, а можно не пройти вообще и часов за сорок. Игра тебе ничего не подсказывает, не водит тебя за ручку, нигде не наказывает и, по сути, ничем, кроме удовольствия от самой игры, не вознаграждает. Соревновательного режима тоже нет (ну, есть очки, которыми меряется народ, но это, как вы понимаете, другое).

… И вот тебе казалось, что все начиналось так неплохо, а потом тебя убивает какой-то слизень, к которому ты не был готов. Хорошо, ты начал заново, приготовился к внезапному слизню - а там в комнате парочка гопников, закурить не найдётся. Хорошо, допустим, усвоил заточку под ребро, воскрес, нашинковал слизня, сломал гопникам гопалку, а потом по невнимательности зарезался об босса, потому что босс острый. Хорошо, понятно, снова воскрес. Умереть насовсем мы не можем, ведь мы - эмиссар самой смерти, слава его китейшеству.

И всё это странно, безмятежно, благостно успокаивает, и я давно не помню игры, в которой баланс её этой самой сложности ощущался бы так хорошо. Не как фрустрация, что ты не понимаешь, что происходит и стучишься лбом в стенку. Не как ощущение, что вот спинномозговая элита кибеспоривных арен, а есть жалкая плесень вроде тебя. Не так, что тут задумал какую-то хитрую механику ради хитрой механики другой человек, а ты сиди разгадывай. Нет. Шаг за шагом, кирпичик за кирпичиком у тебя, именно у тебя, получается лучше.
Как веса в зале растут, только мозг! Такое удовлетворение, ну я не знаю просто.

Скучно не будет - карта генерируется случайно, карточки дают все время разные, по семьдесят уникальных на каждого из четырех героев, а еще артефакты есть и каждое прохождение не похоже на другое. И еще есть концовка и тру-концовка.
А еще есть двадцать последовательно нарастающих уровней сложности, для тех, кто любит еще пожестче, и и так не прощающая ошибок основная сложность.

Не сказать хотя бы пару слов про атмосферу игры всё-таки нельзя - она прекрасная, диковатая и какая то очень… своя?
Ка-кар, говорят культисты в масках птиц, проводящие странные ритуалы и размахивающие серпами. На узких и темных улочках верхнего города клеричка куда-то идет под защитой центуриона - пока мы не переходим им дорогу, теперь они никуда не дойдут, но какой церкви были это слуги и почему у него такие странные, как будто змееподобные узоры на броне? Когда за Silent встречаешь Nemesis - и понимаешь, что у вас похожие способности вы одинаково одеты - и задаешься страшным вопросом - а может она - это я? Заблудившаяся тысячу похождений назад в этих коридорах, преобразованная нечеловеческой магией башни? Кто создал конструкты, которыми забит третий этаж и почему они все едва уловимо похожи на Дефекта и его карты по стилю?

“Slay The Spire” умудряется быть по-настоящему волшебным приключением, оставляющим массу простора для воображения. Это прекрасная иллюстрация к тому, что не обязательно глубоко прорабатывать лор, иногда достаточно махнуть игроку или читателю рукой - и сказать, что вон там холмы, это не просто холмы, это курганы Древних, и словить магическую зачарованность вашей историей он сможет и сам.

Я наиграла полторы сотни часов - и еще обязательно вернусь, чтобы попробовать еще раз попробовать взойти на загадочную башню и снова убить шпиль.

185428109.review:
Парадоксально, але навіть попри те, що ця гра подобається мені, я не можу її рекомендувати.
Так, вона затягує, так у неї велике різноманіття у білдбудуванні, АЛЕ.
Результат забігу залежить тільки від рандому. 
У грі повністю відсутній скіл чек.
Все залежить від густоти паршивості ваших карт та мобів.
1 раз з 5 може випасти дійсно не погана колода з якою з легкістю можна дійти до фінального боса, проте проблема в тому, що деякі елітки / боси буквально можуть контрити вашу колоду. 
Якщо не вистачає дамагу чи броні навіть з не поганим білдом ти швидко відлетиш, якщо цього захоче гра.
Не рідко бувало, що одна елітка чи противний моб просто розривав мені табло тільки через те, що випадали не ті карти до руки. Скільки такий бій не перегравай шанс на успіх мінімальний.
Білд тут теж скласти майже не реально. Краще рестартнути забіг з перших трьох боїв, якщо не випали потрібні карти, ніж пробувати грати колодою із солянки, на яку ти витратиш півгодини і все рівно програєш.
Але навіть при умові, що ти збереш потрібні тобі карти, ти все рівно не зможеш викинути не потрібний шлак, щоб зменшити колоду, бо є ліміт. Та і як я вже казав, деякі білди повністю контряться фінальним босом, якого не реально передбачити до 3 поверху. У кінцевому випадку у бою буде вирішувати рандом. Одного разу сильна карта випаде на початку ходу, а на інший бій доведеться розпочати з простою атакою, яку ти не встиг викинути з колоди. 
+ у цій грі моби люблять накидати тисячу і один дебафів, які в один момент повністю відкидають змогу грати у фізичний дамаг. 
Одним словом, грати прийдеться так, як захоче гра.
Мені подобаються рогалики, але потрібно будувати гру на основі скіла гравця, а не на пустому рандомі, який повністю нівелює досвід та навички гравця.

Загалом, гра чисто таймкіллер. Ідеальна для портативок чи мобілок. 
Грати на повному серйозі я її більше не можу, тому буду заходити чисто по фану на один ран та дивитися що цього разу підкинув мені рандом.
Якщо вам важливий зріз власного скілу та ріст у грі - пройдіть мимо, якщо вам подобається самий процес гри, яка вам підкидує постійно нові умови, то можете спробувати. У грі контенту вистачає.

185402898.review:
Genuinely no idea how this game is popular. Every possible step of the path is loaded with so much completely unfair RNG that it feels like an absolute slog in every single moment of gameplay. It's so fucking slow. There is barely any player agency beside picking the order in which you deal with the RNG you've been dealt. I've yet to have a single run where it hasn't been ended by the simple fact I haven't been dealt a single defense card in a round I'm suddenly receiving like 55 damage in. Ridiculous. Not fun. The only people I can imagine enjoying this schlock are sadomasochists.


UPDATE after playing an additional 10 hours. Don't ask me why I've continued to play a game I still hate, but I guess there is something to be said about the game pissing me off enough to beat it on every single class to prove my assertions right.

I still stand by my review.

With ten additional hours of play and 4 victories, I have yet to feel like my success has ever been my fault. Never once did I beat the game and go "Yeah, I earned that." Every single victory has been hollow and more relief inducing than joy inducing. I only beat the game on the Defect because out of all of the cards in my deck, the only defense card it dealt me on the final boss's final turn, it was the one that negates all damage for one turn. One defense card out of six cards pulled. One defense card. I just lucked out that it was so powerful. I survived on literally one HP.

Most of my runs have been ended by every boss effectively having the same exact, boring ass mechanic of infinitely scaling their strength. The only variance is that they might scale that strength slightly differently. They ALL do it though. So you can't build too much defense, as you'll eventually be out scaled by every single boss in the game. Can't build too much offense, because they'll just randomly one shot you on a turn you pull no defense cards.

The real truth, however, is that you can't deterministically build either one, because you're completely at the whim of the game's RNG on which cards you are dealt after each combat. Good luck getting anything you'll need, you have next to no agency beyond a shop that still might not give you what you need.

185397305.review: I like to use this game as part of my workout routine. I do an exercise every time I get a card reward. Slay the Spire has basically infinite enjoyable replayability with workshop mods, and even the base game has hundreds of hours of enjoyable playtime.

185323007.review:
(First Review)
It's a good game overall. It can be confusing when you first jump in, as the game offers no tutorials. (As far as i'm aware.) But the very first character you play is nigh perfect for your first run. Late-game tends to be a problem though. As not only does the final character you unlock feel so fragile. But also just takes so much to build a truly good strategy with. It really forces you to look at the game like it's nothing more than a luck based joyride. Which is still mostly true anyway. As you keep heading deeper into the games challenges. If you can turn you're mind off and just enjoy playing with your deck. Then you can enjoy this game for quite a while.

(Second Review)
Having played this game further, it all but furthers my likes and dislikes in this game. Having played it, over and over again. Using the exact same character. Using a different character after the first one dies. Even using a modded in character. This game just denies a truly amazing experience. Before I 'rant and rave' about how 'awful and unbalanced' this game is. I will fully admit, i'm sure that i've done many things wrong. That many of my strats and tactics are flawed from the start. This was my first ever deck-building game after all. 

Yet. Ever single time. It just feels as if the game screws me over with complete purpose. I can't even count how many times I took 12-40 unblocked damage right to the face. Just because the game either refused to draw me a single defend card. Or it drew every single one in my entire deck, on the very first turn. Then there was the many times I was all but assured victory. But then the game threw me to the 1 exact Elite boss or random regular enemy that just breaks my deck in half. I get it, luck is supposed to be part of this game. Yet luck shouldn't have such a strong hold on this game. That before i've even left the spawning room itself. I all but lost the game because 80% of the 'blessings' are shitty. Not even counting the 'trade your starting relic for a random boss relic' option. Because that's just asking for punishment. You have options like.

Remove all gold and remove 2 cards.
Lose half health and gain 100 gold.
Lose 7 max health and gain gold/remove cards/upgrade a singular card.
Choose 1 singular extra card to start with.
IF (very big IF) you encounter an enemy, in the next 3 rooms, it has 1 HP. (And then of course, you only see 1 enemy. Should you ever pick that option.)

Most of these options don't even show up unless you can by some small miracle. At least DIE in a boss room. I can see how good the characters can get. I've gotten close to being nigh un-killable at least 4 times. But every time the game just uses luck against me. Withholding the very last card i would need to perfect my strat and ruin my chances. It's still a fun game, but it just sucks the fun out of itself. There is only so many times ANYONE can reach the final boss. And then die because it was a miracle in of itself that you got there with 1 HP left.

EVEN WITH a modded character. I only reached the final boss about 5 times. Let alone finally defeated it a singular time, with that modded in character. If this game wasn't a "luck based joyride" as I called it myself. It would be so much greater than it is. I'm not even griping about losing in general. It's just not fun to spend even 10 minutes trying to reach the final floors. Only to die to some stupid draw of cards or because you risked it all for a possibly decent relic. And then lost over 50 health for something that doesn't have anything to do with your build.

185120939.review:
From when I first picked it up, I could not put this game down.

Some games are a struggle for me to spend time in and take a bit of effort to push me to play them. This game is the total opposite - I have to pull myself away from it to go to bed on time, and even then I'm still thinking of the run I've paused half way through.

Everything about the game is so well done - the slick animations, soft art style, enemy designs and the gameplay loop is so crunchy that I just want more. Easy to start playing, easy to understand, easy to plan next moves, complex enough to build totally broken strategies with each of the four well crafted characters and play styles. By the end of each run, you feel totally overpowered that some builds had me laughing out loud with how broken they felt, but all satisfying to put together.

I will undoubtedly return for more of this game and will definitely be playing the sequel when it is released. The only reason I'm putting this down is that I want to keep going with my backlog to play other games as well. So I played until I unlocked all cards and relics from each character and didn't proceed with the Ascension difficulty levels last the first few.

The fact that this game was built by two people makes this game an even more impressive achievement. Crazy good game.

Не очень.

Мне нравятся карточные игры, вроде бы тут и какое-то разнообразие есть, даже можно пытаться делать билды, но игре очень сильно не хватает баланса, развития персонажа, общей ширины\глубины и как будто души. 

По уровню исполнения ощущается как флэш-игра из 00х, а еще сильно бросается в глаза "математическая база" происходящего в плохом смысле - сложно объяснить, но всегда слишком хорошо видно, что есть наиболее оптимальный путь и для него надо считать каждый ход и несколько наперед (т.е. глупо спамить самой крутой абилкой, а надо подкопить броню, использовать что-то заранее, посмотреть паттерн противника и т.д., и игра очень явно требует это делать постоянно). От этого очень сильно страдает "приключенческая" эмоциональная составляющая игры - если не следовать этому "идеальному" маршруту действий и пытаться просто весело играть, то проиграешь гораздо раньше и недополучишь контент и придется все делать заново.

184983095.review:
Although late to the party with Slay the spire my 44 hours gameplay in two weeks suggests this dungeon crawling deckbuilder not only has its hooks into my soul but can be assured that I will be coming back time and time again.
I consider myself somewhat of an expert at card games. 
Online poker pro and hundreds of study hours on GTO.
Legendary ranked Hearthstone player all modes.
100 hours and many runs completed in ace little indie game, The Dark Horde.
Over 100 hours and runs completed with every suit in Balatro.
Made it to the endboss of the excruciatingly hard Dungeons and degenerate gamblers the blackjack-based roguelike deckbuilder only to have my ass handed back to me on a platter.
Armed with vast experience and expert card skills can I hope to Slay the Spire immediately?
In short No, but Yes.
Slay the spire revolves around crafting a deck of cards by defeating rooms of AI monsters as you plot your way up the map of the spire. Each room will give you rewards once beaten, cards to add to your deck, potions for maxxing combos and synergies or the big-ticket items the “Relics”. 
Relics are given at the start of a run, found in reward chests and shops scattered throughout the map or dropped by Elite enemies. Kept for the entirety of the run and interacting with the cards in your deck if used wisely can create combos and synergies that deal devastating damage, bank untold amounts of block or just start your fight with upgraded stats. 
Finding the right Relic at the right time can put your deck above the power curve of the game and make a previously impossible boss dead within a few turns.
My first run was in short nothing but crap. I took a card at every opportunity, bloated my deck with rubbish and inauspiciously ended the run before sighting the first boss.
Fail, but fun. Fun enough to smash the start button again.
I tried the “Daily climb” next and somehow managed to craft a broken deck that gave me my first completed run. 
900th on the daily leaderboard. 
Learning from the first dismal effort I tried to streamline my deck by keeping the card count low. My thought was the less cards in my deck the more chance I would have at drawing into my combos. I looked for cheap card draw, zero mana cards that had upside and a synergistic build that abused the poison mechanic. 
I somehow managed to have a build that stayed ahead of the enemy’s power curve and ended up beating the final boss quite easily. Quite the turnaround after being defeated by an entry level enemy on the first floor.
Hooked.
44 hours later and having beaten the game with The Ironclad, The Silent and The Defect I feel like I havn’t even scratched the surface of what this game has to offer.
I’ve still got cards to unlock from the Defect class and havn’t even played The Watcher yet. I see many hours ahead learning both of those classes.
The key to the game is losing is paramount to getting better. Whether a losing run unlocks new cards or relics, or it just gives you experience at a new boss mechanic and AI attack pattern the experience you get will leave you in a better place to attempt to slay the Spire the next run.
While losing isn’t fun it almost always is the result of a poor choice. Taking the wrong card, too many or not enough cards in deck, attacking when blocking is wise or vice versa. Even just taking the wrong path on the map or accepting a “reward” from an unexpected traveler can have dire consequences on any given run.
My tips:
Learn cards and interactions. Each class has mechanics that can be abused, and you will need to know them to win the game.
Try different combos. After winning the first run with The Silent I immediately tried to replicate the poison build I had made and failed miserably. Forcing a strategy when not being offered the support for said strategy is pretty much death. 
When offered cards look at your deck and ask yourself is this card going to work well with the other cards in deck and the Relics I have? Each card takes up a card slot and needs to add value to your strategy at least to the value of said card slot.
Minimize damage and use your life bar as a resource.  Taking damage when unnecessary is a sure way to lose at this game, I prefer to play a block and take no damage rather than get in the extra hit myself and leave the fight with low health.
This does not follow with boss fights. At the end of a boss fight your health is replenished to full so as long as you do not die your health bar can be ignored to some extent. 
Beating a boss with 1 life is exactly the same as beating a boss with full health. The boss is still beaten, and you start the next floor with full life anyway.
This is a fantastic title. 
There are Hundreds of hours of gameplay that are as deep or as shallow as you make them. 
Beating a run is a great feeling. 
This game is hard and when beaten you know that you have accomplished something. 
Yes, the graphics are meh and the first few fights are way too easy but past Act 3 all that goes out the window. Its seat of the pants action where each and every decision that you have made previously impacts the end result.
I have heard that Slay the Spire 2 is being developed. 
All I can say is Shut up and take my money!!
Slay the spire is one of if not the best roguelike deck builders ever made 9.5/10. 
Highly Recommended.

184972150.review: Slay the Spire est un excellent mélange de stratégie et de hasard. Chaque partie est différente, et les choix de cartes, de reliques ou de chemins ont toujours un impact. Les personnages offrent des styles variés, et trouver des synergies pour renforcer son deck est vraiment satisfaisant. Certaines cartes peuvent sembler faibles au départ, mais avec les bonnes combinaisons, elles peuvent devenir redoutables. Le côté aléatoire empêche de suivre un "deck autoroute", et il est tout à fait possible de gagner avec des cartes qui, sur le papier, ne paraissent pas optimales, ce qui rend chaque run unique. Le hasard peut frustrer parfois, mais ça rend les victoires d’autant plus gratifiantes. C’est un jeu qui vous pousse à réfléchir et à s’adapter à chaque situation, et il est très facile de se laisser embarquer pour "juste une run de plus". Si vous aimez les rogue-like ou les jeux de deck-building, il mérite au moins un essai.

「あと一回、あと一回」と続けているうちに、気づけば全実績を達成していました。ジャンルの金字塔として、これは本当に伊達じゃない面白さです。

何より素晴らしいのはリプレイ性の高さ。完走にはおおよそ2時間未満、失敗を含めたプレイでも30分ほどかかります。しかし、どのプレイでも、理不尽な敵の猛攻やデッキ事故、悪いカード運に悩まされることもあれば、たった1枚のカードでジリ貧のデッキ状況が一変することや、運が良ければラスボスに無法できることもあり、勝ち筋も複数パターンが存在。毎回新鮮なプレイ体験が楽しめます。

基本的にプレイヤー不利な高アセンションに挑む中で、知識を積み重ねて壁を越える達成感が感じられる点も素晴らしいです。理不尽ではありますが、絶対に越えられないわけではない。そんな絶妙な難易度調整が次のプレイを呼び、気づけば全実績を解除していました。

スレスパ2が来る前に全クリできてよかった！

184846367.review:
A really enjoyable experience. If a friend would have not bought it for me on christmas, I would have never known. XD

You fight and plan your path through dungeons, pick up action cards, as well as relics as you go. Sounds simple, but there is quite a lot of strategy to it and exploits of the game system to be found. The random loot can be annoying, especially if you have a particular playstyle in mind. However, it's also the spice, which makes it rewarding, as every run will be unique. You feel pretty proud once you managed to take all 4 chars into the finish line. Also plenty of chance to unlock extras, a true final boss etc., for those who want to hone their skill in the game.

184797763.review:
Лучший карточный рогалик, в который я играл
Множество билдов, зелек, персов, реликов, игровых ситуаций и оригинальных противников из-за чего каждый забег кажется разным и запоминающимся!
Мое уважение за то, что в качестве усложнения игры вместо тупого накручивание урона, ограничиваются некоторые возможности игрока, усложняются и изменяются паттерны атак противников, а также события становятся более неблагоприятными для игрока! На первый вгляд эти сложности ниочем, но эти сложности накапливаются и делают игру на 20-ом возвышении в тысячу раз сложнее.
Единственным минусом игры может быть рандом, но именно рандом делает каждый забег разнообразным и интересным, так как всегда есть возможность пройти забег, и поиск этой возможности доставляет большое удовольствие. 
Игра заставляет вас адаптироваться и расчитывать каждый свой ход, при этом предоставляет множество способов как пройти забег, а каждый босс в конце каждого акта будет испытанием для вашего собранного билда.
Огромная вариативность прохождения и разный игровой опыт от каждого забега делает эту игру лучшим рогаликом в моем списке

Slay the Spire was the first game I ever 100% completed on Steam, and it’s still my favorite deck builder – easily one of my favorite genres.

What makes it so special is how versatile the characters are, each offering a completely different playstyle. On top of that, the enemy and boss design is brilliant. Every fight feels like a test of your deck’s strengths: do you have enough front-loaded damage, solid defense, or the ability to handle fights with either very few or tons of cards played per turn?

It’s a masterpiece in design and endlessly replayable. Slay the Spire 2 is now my most anticipated game, and I can’t wait to see where they take the series next.

184683386.review:
Slay the Spire was my 2nd (after Darkest Dungeon) foray into roguelikes and 1st ever into deckbuilders. Despite this, I was drawn in immediately. The game eases you into its mechanics gradually, but it manages to do so without holding you by the hand, instead letting you figure things out on your own. And trust me - there is a lot to figure out. Every fight is a puzzle, every card choice a mental challenge, and every relic you find has the potential to open the door to completely new possibilities. However, there is no in-game time pressure, so you can take as long as you need to think of that amazing combo that will obliterate your foes or that genius deck synergy. 

As you progress through the game, you will unlock characters, each offering a unique playstyle, reveal new, more complex abilities, but also face greater challenges. But don't fret - the difficulty curve in Slay the Spire is a gentle one. Every time the difficulty increases, that increase is noticeable, but never feels impossible to overcome. And if you're struggling, there's nothing stopping you from staying at your difficulty level until you feel more comfortable.  

Despite its complexity, Slay the Spire never actually felt stressful, and not just because of the total lack of in-game time pressure. While dying does mean you need to restart the attempt, you only lose that single attempt, while maintaining the overall progression. Also, finishing a run should never take longer than 2 hours, meaning that even if you die at the very end, you don't lose that much real-life time, which significantly limits potential frustration. 

So go forth, challenge the game to a battle of strategy and wits. Ascend the Spire and perish so that eventually you emerge victorious. As far as I am concerned, your money and your time will be well-spent.

- 弄一张“灼热攻击+”，在休息处能无限升级。第n次升级能增加n+3的威力。所以卡的总威力是等差数列求和。威力是x^2级别的增长。
- 遇到复制手牌的 ？事件就复制一张。只要能复制2次，拿到3张，就能横着走。
- 剩余卡牌要屯“秘密武器”， “秘密技法”，和“搜寻”。秘密武器->灼热攻击，秘密技法->搜寻->灼热攻击，能快速从卡组中检索抽取这个Over Power卡。小怪和boss一局秒。
- 保险起见，可以增加一张“深呼吸”，能把弃牌堆的卡放回抽牌堆，能再次检索抽取。
- 可以囤些“液态记忆”药水，也能再次从弃牌堆拿起再用。仅作救急。
- 能量保证6个点或以上，保证躺着打爆1000级。

184580705.review:
Wow! I have never enjoyed a card battler so much before. When you are still learning the game, it can feel unfair or too RNG at times but once you understand the pros and cons of a character and start noticing build synergies the game truly comes on its own.

The sense of overcoming the many bosses in the game is unique and only Monster Train has come close to this style and feel of card battle gameplay.

If you are new to card battlers, I recommend trying Monster Train first. Once you are a little comfortable with MT, come back and play Slay The Spire. Both offer very different and really fun experiences. Or play them both! Either way you win by playing these beautiful games!

184558555.review:
I've played other roguelike deckbuilder games such as Dawncaster or Night of the full moon and I love the genre. Sadly, I was a bit disappointed with this game. 

I've unlocked 3 of the 4 chars, and two of them seem underwhelming. I also really dislike the limited energie economics. There are some cards and relics which give additional energie (which is the currency to play cards). But by and large, you are stuck with playing 3-4 cards each turn. Because of this, there's only a small chance to built cool combos. 

It also means that luck is important - moreso than usual for the genre. The enemy will hit you for 30 damage next turn? Better hope you get lucky and draw the right cards. Because of the action economy, you can't cycle through your deck well. Drawing additional cards mostly costs energie. So if you don't have block cards, you can spend one of your three(ish) energies to draw cards. But then you can only play two more cards, so even if you get lucky and draw good cards, that likely won't be enough to do a decent dent in the damage. 

It's not a bad game by any stretch. But for me, it's an average game in a great genre. Given that there are imho free to play (mobile) games which do it better, it's difficult to justify the pricetag.

这个游戏小时候在电视上看有人直播玩过，那时候找遍少儿频道炫漫卡通等也找不到喜欢看的动画片，我都会调到80台看游戏直播，那时候不知道播出的游戏都是啥，上大学才知道播出的游戏都是steam里的游戏。后来杀戮尖塔打折，这个游戏又重新进入我的视野，点进它的页面时，脑海中突然就涌现出小时候抱着电视机看那个黑框眼镜锅盖头的老哥玩这款我看不懂的游戏，对了，老哥旁边老是坐着一个漂亮姐姐，印象中是穿着羊毛衫，漂亮的很，可把咱迷坏了。
    之后我就想买来玩玩看，进入游戏，游戏中的按钮点击后的音效听着很舒服，打牌的手感也好棒，就这样也没有看攻略就玩了起来，虽然一直死，但是每打完小怪给的牌我都津津有味的看它的解释，然后再去想它跟我有的牌配起来吊不吊，就这样挺开心的玩了几把战士，后来看视频别人玩猎手小刀砍得好爽，我就去玩猎手；但是第一次有点傻屌，拿了刀刃之舞我还拿了那个给一个能量但一回合只能出六张牌的遗物。当我兴冲冲的准备用我升级的刀刃之舞爽一把的时候才发现不让我出牌了，奶奶滴，气煞我也，那一把没多久就凉凉了。之后又玩了刚开始觉得好废的机器人，玩了几把感觉不好玩又去玩观者，玩观者感觉愤怒状态好厉害👍🏻就一直用这个状态，我都不用冷静，结果不对啊，这小怪打我咋恁疼，奶奶滴原来不仅我伤害翻倍，受伤害也翻倍。后来搞清楚了通关了一次又去玩机器人，就只有机器人还没通关过，我也想打心脏就又玩上了当时感觉很废的坤器人，瞎几把打了几把后有一把运气好，抓了好多能力牌，我还有个打出一个能力牌随机一个牌零费的遗物，哎嘿，您猜怎么着，我给通关了，哎呦喂你还别说，这小坤器人还挺有意思。
    再后来看见了流派打法，我玩战士就老想抓堡垒，其他牌都不瞅，导致俺游戏体验很差，老是第一层没打过就gg，后来看开了，这jb玩意儿就是随缘，就回到我瞅着我牌配合着拿牌，也有幸打了一把杂乱的防战，你别说还挺爽奥，给咱成就999格挡也完成了。
    最后用猎手打碎心，第一次干到第三层就结束了，咋回事捏，咱就去搜，奥，搜嘎，原来要集齐那该死的三个宝石碎片，第一次没打那个转圈圈的精英怪没拿够宝石碎片（因为想打心脏，害怕撑不到第三层，咱都是绕着精英怪走）。知道了这玩意我今天又用猎手干了一把，拿到了超绝催化剂，只是刷视频听主播提个这张牌很厉害，没想到折磨流弊奥，给我把倏忽魔都给毒死了，也不怕那个自带堡垒的圆球球怪了，但是我牌有三十多张又没拿好的格挡牌，拿了个幽魂形态咱还不敢用，运气不好就叠不了毒，打心脏重新战斗了好几次才以九滴血量的优势险胜，奶奶滴打赢我开心的搁宿舍乱叫，跟室友说，爽爽爽，奶奶滴终于给它干死了，当时开心的跟小时候俺爷过年给俺买遥控汽车的那种感觉了，真是感觉好久没这么开心了，高中毕业买新手机也没恁开心。嘿嘿寒假我要把这几个人物翻来覆去的狠狠地玩弄😡。
   最后最后，这还是咱第一次写这么多嘞，今天打完心脏真滴很开心😁有感而发。希望像咱一样打折入手嘞都能耐心嘞玩玩杀戮尖塔，真嘞可好玩，玩之前白去看恁老些攻略，自己搁游戏里琢磨琢磨吃吃亏才能更好嘞体会这个游戏玩住有多美😍🤗

184515824.review:
I don't understand why this game has overwhelmingly positive reviews. 

From the very beginning I felt that this game is worse than Darkest Dungeon or Tainted Grail because of the lack of the home hub and TOTAL dependence on the outcome of the randomised events that you encounter. In DD or TG you could directly affect every run you will be having by available amount of upgrades that you invested in your hub or investing it in your starting characteristics, hence it straightly did raise the probability of winning (or at least easing the pain during your run for sure). Here you can't directly affect it, the whale in the start of every run offers you very limited choices that I can't say really helpful most of time. You can't change your starting deck (except limited whale offerings), you may hope that some useful cards will be dropped in the nearest starting mob fights (or in the shop), but that's all: no controllable fun for you. No direct tangible intervention into RNG at all. Some of the relics that you may encounter are completely useless, so game doesn't really help you, but effectively messing with little there's left of what the player has any control over

184384262.review:
[h1] 2025年1月1日： 冬促史低入手，游玩了12个小时 [/h1]
目前已经游玩了12个小时了，只能说有难度，如果你是萌新，又像我自己一样喜欢自己闯关，不喜欢查攻略的话，那么注意了，仅靠你自己的想法可能是过不去的，慎重入手。
如果你觉得挑战才是游戏的意义，那么好，恭喜你，找到你心目中的游戏了，赶紧购买下载挑战不可能吧。
开了前三个职业，但是一直在跟第一个职业耗，可惜还是没有过去。
[h2] 一、游戏难度 [/h2]
游戏给我的感觉是，单个boss都没有太大的难度，但是串起来就不一样了，难度叠加，因为补给点相对较少，只有一到两个，所以你不得不一开始就是控制血量，保持到一个健康的状态以应对后面的boss，也就是说设计到运营。
[h2] 二、卡牌 [/h2]
游戏的废卡非常少，几乎都有重要的作用，但是如果你不加分辨全部都收取到自己的牌库中的话，那么恭喜你，你把所有的卡都变成了废卡。这个游戏卡不能贪，你要按一个方向选卡，加力量就要侧重加力量，你不能力量了防守两个都点满，那样只会让你的卡库爆满。然后在等关键牌和浪费法力中迎接死亡。
[h2] 三、boss设计 [/h2]
boss设计是有特点的，每个小boss和大boss的机制都不一样也没有重复，所以打boss可能要多打几遍才能摸清套路和机制，如果你不看攻略的话。所以，这需要花费相当多的时间来闯关，每个boo也没有特别难的，机制也没有特别逆天的，但是需要把握时机，时机过了，基本就宣布结束了，即使你侥幸过了，后面如果还有其它的boss的话，你还是很难赢的，那种步步维艰的感觉，真的是一种折磨
[h2] 四、卡牌画风 [/h2]
卡牌画风还是比较简单舒服的，颜色不饱和，注重整体的舒适感，没有那种过艳或者过锐的意思。人物画的比较简单但是也是能入得眼的，在卡牌游戏来说，是可以的，过得去的。
[h2] 五、吸引力 [/h2]
一直输，肯定是想赢的，但是即使你花精力去研究了但是还是很难赢，自己努力也赢不了的话，我就不太想查攻略了，所以整体上说就是前面还是比较能激发玩家的好胜心里的，可是后面就受挫感严重了，当然，我查攻略肯定是过得去的，但是怎么说，卡牌游戏查攻略的话，基本剩下可操作的就是运气问题了，会极大地让人丧失成就感。游戏还是不错的，听说第二部就要出来了，看看第二部什么情况吧。

184307034.review:
Мабуть, не існує карткових рогаликів, де б у відгуках хтось не згадав [b]Slay the Spire[/b]. Мовляв, "ця гра — клон StS". Схоже, мені варто було починати знайомство з жанром саме з цієї гри. З іншими подібними проєктами у мене якось не склалося, а тут усе вийшло інакше.

Почнемо з головного: [b]Slay the Spire[/b] зроблена неймовірно якісно. Навіть це м’яко сказано — гра сприймається як цілісний, живий організм. У ній усе в міру, і все настільки, наскільки потрібно. Баланс ідеально налаштований: грати складно, але завжди розумієш, що пройти можна, якщо трохи подумати, докласти зусиль або зазирнути в гайди. Гра обов’язково винагороджує за старання, що неймовірно захоплює.

Гадаю, саме це й є основною проблемою більшості "клонів". Ти бачиш знайому механіку StS, яка працювала чудово, але в клонах щось змінюють: додають зайві елементи або видаляють важливі механіки, змінюючи цілісність гри. Наприклад, умовно "відрізають ногу", "руку" або навіть "причіпляють зайву руку до голови". Логічно, що це дратує. Особливо, коли в клоні подобається сетинг, наприклад, морська тематика. Якщо в оригіналі все працювало ідеально, навіщо щось змінювати?

[h3]Кому підійде гра?[/h3]
Важливо любити карткові ігри. Так, це звучить очевидно, але поясню: гонки, наприклад, можна пройти, навіть не розуміючись на машинах. Тут усе інакше. Треба читати карти, розуміти їхню синергію і розбиратися в механіці. Це не [b]Brotato[/b], де після важкого дня можна розслабитися і "гнати хвилю ворогів". Тут доведеться напружити мізки. Також гра додає випадкові варіації, які можуть зробити створену гру цікавою, але точно не такою, що приведе вас до перемоги. Тому процес у цій грі варто любити, інакше є велика ймовірність, що ви просто засмутитесь.

До речі, завдяки досвіду в [b]Slay the Spire[/b] я повернувся до старих карткових ігор, які колись закинув. Цікаво, що мені здалося, ніби їхні розробники не дуже дбали про те, щоб навчити новачків. Склалося враження, що вони були впевнені: їхній продукт купуватимуть тільки досвідчені гравці, які вже знайомі з жанром.

[b]Мотивація[/b]
Розумієте, досвід часто залишається невидимим. Можна два вечори нічого не досягати в грі, а потім почати її проходити легко і просто. А бонусом стануть і всі «клони». Тож не засмучуйтеся, якщо у вас нічого не виходить із першого разу.

[h3]Підсумок[/h3]
[b]Slay the Spire[/b] — чудова гра для знайомства з картковими рогаликами. Щоб отримати максимум задоволення, важливо любити карткові ігри. Якщо це про вас — сміливо починайте!

I lied, actually. I DO recommend this game, just not to myself. The game is fun, and it got popular for a reason, But the card based (luck based genre) rougelike (also luck based genre) is just a bit TOO luck heavy for me.
It was fine when I was learning everything, and it was still fine later in ascension mode when I was still learning here and there. But now that I've seen 97% of it and I'm STILL struggling at around ascension 6 or 8 or whatever, it feels like my decisions aren't helping or even mattering, like the only answer is to just keep going until I get lucky. When I die, I can't see where I could've improved, where I messed up, or how I could've won. Because at some point, It's actually down to just luck, where no player skill, no wisdom, no possible line of thinking could've let you go any farther than luck allows.
Look at me, with all my complaints in the optional difficulty increase. I know I would have never gotten there if the game wasn't fun to begin with. Ignore me, just try the game. It's far more fun than frustrating for far longer than most games. I DO recommend it, just don't try to play ONLY this for far longer than you probably should. This legendary game spawned many like it, after all!

184245851.review:
Perhaps the ultimate victory of substance over style in gaming history. Everything about STS is incredibly engaging, the gameplay loop is fiendishly addictive- easy to learn but truly with immense depth. One of the best games out there to chuck on for an hour or two after work and just relax with. No wonder it's so enduringly popular.

The only criticism I have is that, as much as I love it, I can't deny it kinda looks a bit wonky. There's a mudiness, occasionally an amateurishness, to the art and while there's the occasional striking enemy or character design, too many are just kind of boring or generic. It's all surface level- everything underneath is working well- but it is noticeable. 

Ultimately though, this compromise means very little. function over form, substance over style, STS is a real victory. And the upcoming STS 2 is a perfect chance to just give it a little more style and polish to make the formula truly perfect.

游玩7小时，总体而言游戏可玩性非常高，原因是肉鸽元素拉满，关卡和道具随机性很高，使玩家能接受高重复的游玩。但有一些问题我认为对刚游玩的玩家很不友好，主要是很多卡牌和遗物需要经验解锁，关卡推进比较深入的时候，新手会发现自己的卡牌使用起来会卡手。还有一个问题就是有些Boss对一些套路玩法很针对，例如第三阶段的拿怀表的Boss就很针对“静默猎手”中通过洗牌玩法的套路。

After approximately seven hours of gameplay, the overall experience demonstrates high playability due to the rich inclusion of rogue-like elements and a high degree of randomness in levels and items. This design allows players to tolerate repeated plays without feeling monotonous. However, there are certain aspects that present challenges for new players. For instance, many cards and relics require unlocking through accumulated experience, which may hinder novices from progressing smoothly as they advance in levels. Additionally, some bosses exhibit specific mechanics that cater to particular playstyles, such as the Stage 3 boss with a pocket watch, which is particularly challenging for players using the shuffled deck strategy in Silent Hunter.

I originally got this on the nintendo switch, and then moved to steam a couple days ago. Because of this, despite steam not knowing it I have completed a great deal of the game's achievements and have loved every minute of it. When I first started playing, I was fascinated by every mechanic of it and the replayability of it. Yeah, that didn't change. the main reason I wanted to switch to steam was for the steam workshop, and I can easily say it was 100% WORTH IT. The quality of life mods alone make the workshop feature fantastic. 

BUT

this game isn't easy. It is one of the most difficult games I have ever played. If you are playing this game for the first time or the genre of roguelike deckbuilders for the first time, It is extremely necessary to watch some how-to videos on youtube, because even if you're at half health, you probably still want to smith instead of healing at rest sites. 

oh, and if you are thinking of waiting until Slay the Spire two comes out so you can get started with the sequel, I still recommend buying this game first. The developers have often said that the reason they are making a sequel is that they are taking literally everything to the next level. In a couple months this is probably going to be the simpler version.

184025382.review:
I went into this game half-blind, knowing it was a well-respected roguelike deckbuilding game, which is a genre I love, but was taken a bit apart by the art style of it.

But I decided to grab it in the sale and it has been totally worth it. The deckbuilding aspect of the game is absolutely perfect, and the navigation scheme, while simple, adds the complexity of decision-making to the run.

There are for different characters with enitrely separate decklist to choose from, and they play very differently. Even after completing your first run, you will unlock the ascension mode, which consists of the base game with increasing levels of difficulty (up to 20!) so it has replay value for dozens of hours.

It is also a great game to play on a train/plane with a Steam Deck, and is very battery-friendly. Easy 8-8.5/10 for me, would totally recommend even for full price, and the sale discounted price is a total steal

Lo lindo de este juego es que no hay ningun tipo de mejoras fuera de la run, y lo unico que mejora es tu comprension del juego. Tiene mucha re-jugabilidad gracias a sus niveles de ascension que aportan muchas horas de gameplay. A su vez cada personajes es muy distinto al punto de casi jugar juegos diferentes a la hora de cambiar ente ellos. 

En conclusion, es un juego muy recomendable, sobretodo si te gustan los juegos de deckbuilding.

183982719.review:
"Point to the obvious" bir inceleme olacak çünkü bu oyuna dair söylenecek çoğu şey söylendi malesef.

İncelemeye geçmeden, oyun tam olarak indie oyunlardan yapmasını beklediğim çoğu şeyi yapmış. Büyük bir oyun şirketi veya baskıcı bir dağıtıcı altında kabul görmeyecek yaratıcı bir gameplay fikrini güzel bir sanat tasarımı ile, arka planda anlatmak için pek uğraşmadığı bir lore ekleyerek önümüze sunmuş. Indie oyun yapımcılarının kısıtlı bütçe karşısında kullanabilecekleri en büyük silah budur. Herhangi bir büyük oyun şirketine gidip "elimde turn-based, kart oyunu mekanikleri olan, rogue-like, strateji bazlı, dungeon crawler, character rpg ögelerinin karışımı bir oyun fikri var" diyecek olursanız alacağınız cevap %90 "sg icat çıkarma başımıza" veya "bu oyun tutmaz" olacaktır. Ama kendi bütçeniz olursa nasıl bir oyun yapacağınıza kimse karışamaz. Ey indie oyun geliştiricileri, artık birbirinin kopyası sikko oyunlar yapmak yerine en büyük avantajınız olan özgürlüğünüzü kullanıp böyle orijinal işler yapmanız gerektiğini ne zaman anlayacaksınız?

Neyse, gameplaye gelelim. Kendinizi akışta hissettiğiniz bir gameplay mevcut. Öyle ki oyun oynarken ip yumağı gibi açılıyor ve kendinize sürekli "ulan şu karakteri açınca nolacak" "şunu yenersem nolacak" "bir daha deneyim hadi" derken saatleriniz geçiyor ve flowda kayboluyorsunuz. Oyundaki kartların her biri özenle düşünülmüş, enerji yönetimi ve önünüze gelen item seçimleri özenle seçilmiş. Ayrıca seed mantığıyla her baştan başladığınızda rastgele bir dungeon oluştuğu ve her oynayışınızda farklı bir desteye sahip olduğunuz için tekrara da binmiyor, sıkılmıyorsunuz. Düşman ve boss tasarımları da gayet iyi. Zorluk dengesi iyi ayarlanmış. Bosslar gayet zor. Hepsine ayrı bir strateji kurmanız, bir deste kurmanız gerekiyor. Ya da elinizdeki desteyi oynanışa adapte etmeniz gerekiyor. Özetle gameplay gayet iyi, gönül rahatlığıyla oynayabilirsiniz.

Gelelim sanat tasarımına. Gayet kendince stilistik; fantastik evrenini, atmosferini, karakterlerin kendilerine özgü özelliklerini gayet güzel yansıtan bir sanat tasarımı mevcut. Üzerine düşünülmüş ve uğraşılmış olduğu apaçık. Kendince bir yamukluğu ve çirkinliği de var, bu da ayrıyeten bir çocuksuluk, bir hava katmış.

Hikaye hakkında bir şey demeyeceğim çünkü oyunun derdi bir hikaye anlatmak değil, flowa sokan bir gameplay sunmak. Dark Souls, Doom Eternal gibi yapımlardan aşina olduğumuz çevresel hikaye anlatım tekniğini kullanıyor. Karşılaştığınız her NPC diyaloğunu, aldığınız her itemin açıklamasını, her boss repliğini dikkat ederek okursanız kafanızda bir hikaye oturuyor ama dediğim gibi oyunun derdi hikayesini oyuncuya doğrudan aktarmak değil. Siz de benim gibi oyunu saatlerce keyif ala ala oynadıktan sonra internette "Slay the Spire lore" diye aratarak, hiç uğraşmadan lore'a hakim olabilirsiniz.

Kısacası çok eğlendim. Arkada bir podcast açıp elim boş durmasın diye gittiğim, ancak kendi başına da beni gayet eğlendiren yegane oyunlardan. Oyunun kendi fiyatı 11.50 dolar. Gayet makul bi fiyat ancak oyunun çıkışı üzerinden 4 sene geçtiği için çok iyi indirimler alıyor. Şu an kış indiriminde 2.87 dolar, bu oyun için neredeyse bedava. En başta saydığım kategorilerden hiçbiriyle aranız yoksa bile bir şans vermenizi tavsiye ederim. 2. oyunu sabrsızlıkla bekliyorum, umarım daha da çeşitli bi gameplay sunarlar

183972884.review:
Slay the Spire - 10/10
“One more run” syndrome has never been this addictive.

Slay the Spire masterfully combines deck-building, roguelike progression, and strategic combat into a game that's as challenging as it is rewarding. Every decision matters, from card choices to navigating the dynamic map. The diversity of the characters and their unique playstyles keep the experience fresh, while the random events and relics ensure no two runs are ever the same.

Whether you're a strategy veteran or a casual gamer, this game pulls you in with its simple mechanics and keeps you hooked with its endless depth. Perfect for both quick sessions and hours-long marathons. Highly recommended!

不论从开局三国杀一样一刀一刀砍怪，还是到后期开腐化狂甩无消耗技能牌，游戏的数值都被设计者算计的明明白白，没有逆天卡和逆天道具影响平衡，只有各种牌和遗物组合的花式游戏构筑。光战士这职业就有各种可深挖的机制卡，抽牌加盾，完美打击，叠盾反击，腐化零消耗，吸血鬼，叠攻卡，叠力重击卡，无限升级卡，无限吸血卡，斩杀升级卡，烧血加力卡等等等，一个机制走到黑还是各个机制相辅相成，都看玩家自己的选择。某些关键牌加入牌组会让你的卡组发生质变，而一些万金油卡组也能在很多不同卡组里发挥作用，重要的是每一张牌都有功效，每一张牌都平等的有理由的在你的卡组中占有一席之地。
花样百出的玩法，近乎完美的数值平衡，充满惊喜的游玩历程，这些要素在以往的各种游戏中，得其一便是佳作，而杀戮尖塔把他发挥到了极致，即使他只是个回合制卡牌类游戏，这种经常被冠以无聊之名的游戏模式，也注定难以掩盖他的光芒

Card games like this, Magic: the Gathering, Balatro all have an element of luck that gives the player a limited amount of agency to sculpt a strategy based on what appears for them. 
For some reason, Slay the Spire is completely unsatisfying to me when I feel the boundaries of this limited agency. Something about the game is just not engaging enough to keep me playing strategies I don't care much for in wait of the ones that I do find really fun.
If you don't like exploring strategies that don't excite you in card games, Slay the Spire might not be your thing.

183775390.review:
[h2]Maestría en Estrategia y Construcción de Mazos[/h2]

Slay the Spire, desarrollado por MegaCrit, combina magistralmente los géneros roguelike y construcción de mazos, dando lugar a una experiencia única y adictiva que ha redefinido ambos estilos de juego. Aquí, cada decisión cuenta, y la planificación estratégica es clave para ascender por la torre que da nombre al título.

[b]Jugabilidad: Decisiones que definen tu camino[/b]
En Slay the Spire, el objetivo es claro: sobrevivir y avanzar por niveles generados proceduralmente en una torre llena de enemigos, eventos y recompensas. Para lograrlo, cada jugador debe construir y optimizar su mazo de cartas, que define su estrategia en combate.

Los elementos centrales de la jugabilidad incluyen:

-Variedad de personajes: Cada uno cuenta con habilidades, cartas y reliquias exclusivas que cambian drásticamente el enfoque del juego. Desde el equilibrado Ironclad hasta el versátil Silent, cada partida se siente única.

-Combates tácticos: Los enfrentamientos por turnos requieren analizar cuidadosamente los patrones de ataque enemigos para maximizar el daño mientras minimizas las bajas.

-Reliquias y eventos: A medida que exploras, encontrarás reliquias que modifican tu estilo de juego, además de eventos que ofrecen desafíos o recompensas inesperadas.

-Riesgo vs. recompensa: Administrar tus recursos, decidir qué rutas tomar y cómo evolucionar tu mazo define el éxito en cada partida.

[b]Estilo artístico y presentación[/b]
El apartado visual de Slay the Spire tiene un estilo minimalista pero efectivo, con un diseño que favorece la claridad en combate y navegación. Aunque no deslumbra gráficamente, su enfoque artístico asegura que lo importante sea siempre visible y comprensible.

La banda sonora acompaña bien la experiencia, con temas que refuerzan la atmósfera de tensión, descubrimiento y progreso.

[b]Rejugabilidad: Cada partida, una nueva aventura[/b]
Con su enfoque roguelike, Slay the Spire garantiza que ninguna ascensión sea igual a la anterior. El mapa, los enemigos, las cartas y las reliquias se generan de forma procedural, ofreciendo una variedad infinita de combinaciones y desafíos.

Además, el juego incluye:

-Desafíos diarios: Modos especiales con reglas únicas para quienes buscan nuevas experiencias.

-Mods de la comunidad: A través de Steam Workshop, la comunidad ha creado expansiones y modificaciones que enriquecen aún más el juego.

[b]Conclusión[/b]
Slay the Spire es un juego que recompensa la paciencia, el análisis y la creatividad. Su mezcla de estrategia y azar lo convierte en una experiencia profundamente satisfactoria para los jugadores que disfrutan de desafíos intelectuales y mecánicas profundas.

Si disfrutas de juegos de estrategia donde tus decisiones importan, o si te atraen los roguelikes que desafían tu ingenio, Slay the Spire es una elección excelente. Su mezcla única de construcción de mazos y exploración estratégica lo convierte en una experiencia imprescindible para jugadores que buscan algo fresco y desafiante.

Thanks Marina!! ^^

183701600.review:
Well... I don't really know what to think. I may have only scratched the surface so I won't make a negative comment but here are some remarks I have for now:

- The game is enjoyable, the roguelike mechanic where you unlock new possible cards as you run is rather enjoyable although not necessary for now because the difficulty is far too low for it to be needed to complete the tower.
I'm at 13 hours of play. For the moment I finished the tower after 4 hours (2nd run, I took the time to look at everything and think about each choice). I finished the daily challenge on the first try. The challenge is original but is not necessarily very engaging. In any case, not the one I came across.

So what's left. Start again with a higher difficulty level now that the ascension is unlocked? Why not. Let's say that the beginning was supposed to be complicated when I read the comments and finally it's rather the opposite. What I'd remember for now is that it's a good game to relax and pass the time but not to be theorized. It remains to be seen if the ascension changes anything and if the downfall mod too.

Overall, I don't think this game deserves a negative rating no matter what. It's still a good game, especially for its price. I would recommend it to anyone if it's on sale. But it's not a brain-twisting game with incredible depth as some comments may have suggested. I may be wrong, once again I'm only at the beginning of the game. It seems rather simple to me in principle.

183694290.review:
Um jogo que mistura deckbuilding com o estilo roguelike é simplesmente genial. Cada um dos 4 protagonistas tem arquétipos exclusivos, como o Rígido que é meio masoquista, decks focados em se dar dano e exaurir cartas, a Sorrateira que é bem rápida, com decks focados em jogar várias cartas no mesmo turno e o Defeituoso, que vai ficando mais forte quanto mais turnos passam, com decks focados em acumular efeitos.

O gráfico não é nada incrível e a história é quase inexistente, mas a gameplay compensa bastante e quanto mais você vai entendendo como lidar com os obstáculos (inimigos, bosses e até o próprio deckbuilding) mais inspirado você vai ficar com as opções que tem. Recomendo bastante.

По мимо этого можно самому настроить билд начала игры и трудности что увеличивает количество проведенного времени на + 100 часов. Персонажей достаточно чтобы провести еще по + 50-100 часов за каждого!!
Давно уже прошел данный шедевр и вернулся в очередной раз добить достижения и тут есть один минус:
Достижение по возвышению +20. Тут достаточно сложно собрать билд и зависит много от рандома и ты понимаешь что большая часть игры в некоторых моментах построена на удачи. Не повезло - проиграл

183593438.review:
Sometimes, I’m in the mood for something different—something that doesn’t require me to aim for headshots or stay hyper-focused for hours on end. That’s when Slay the Spire becomes my go-to game. It’s the perfect blend of relaxation and strategy, a game that lets you engage deeply without the constant adrenaline rush of fast-paced action.

One of my favorite things about Slay the Spire is how rewarding it feels to build a great deck. There’s nothing quite like pulling off a perfect synergy between cards and watching your strategy unfold flawlessly. And even when things don’t go your way, the game’s roguelike nature makes each loss a chance to learn and improve for the next run.

If you’re looking for a game that’s easy to pick up but hard to master, Slay the Spire is a must-try. It’s an oasis of calm in a world of high-octane gaming, and I can’t recommend it enough.

183587012.review:
Easy to get into with an easy to understand interface, Slay the Spire is a player friendly game that rewards the player with fun combat and neat card abilities. I find it to be the most approachable card rogue-like out there. 

It's certainly tough as nails in the later stages, but that's where the depth and fun is as well. The enemies you fight later on will have you in fits, so you must tinker and experiment with your deck, figure out the best strategies. On one successful run I focused on building a defense deck, making big blocks to protect me from major damage.

I can see why so many games out there were inspired by Slay the Spire. Some could still learn more from Slay and understand the design principles of simplicity and the benefits of not bombarding the player with too many tutorials.
